series.title: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 353 TPS How to Stand Out in an Interview—Even If You've Been Laid Off
episodes.summary: A listener wonders how to manage her frustration after being laid off twice. Are your emotions getting in the way of acheiving your goals?  Lisa provides strategies to manage your emotions and acheive success. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/2btNBk5

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 352 TPS How to Change Topics Mid-Conversation
episodes.summary: Do you ever find yourself in a conversation you don’t want to be having? Or maybe the subject has just gone on for too long. There are some polite ways to lead the conversation in a direction hopefully everyone will enjoy. Lisa B. Marshall, aka The Public Speaker, shows you how. Read full transcript here: http://bit.ly/2btyNB9

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 351 TPS How to Express Anger in a Healthy Way
episodes.summary: Do you struggle with understanding or managing anger? Do you wonder how to communicate when you’re feeling angry? Lisa B. Marshall, aka The Public Speaker, has some tips to help. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/2b7lhoQ

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 350 TPS Should You Disclose Health Conditions to Your Boss?
episodes.summary: Do you wonder how much of a health issue should be disclosed? Lisa B. Marshall, aka The Public Speaker, answers that question and more. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/2alOCeU

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 349 TPS How to Tactfully Disagree with Someone
episodes.summary: We all find ourselves in disagreements occasionally. So what should you do? Keep your mouth shut or say what you think? And if you speak up, what should you say? Lisa B. Marshall, aka The Public Speaker, has the answers. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/29YhIgT

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 348 TPS How to Break the News to Your Teen
episodes.summary: Wondering how to share sensitive information with a young adult child? Lisa B. Marshall, aka The Public Speaker, shares a personal story, and a recent study indicating the best way to share sensitive information with an older child. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/29IHybZ

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 347 TPS Positivity and Listening Fueled Success for Sam Adams Founder
episodes.summary: Do you wonder how some entrepreneurs become wildly successful? In many cases, attitude is the primary key to success, and communication skills is the second key. Here, Lisa B. Marshall, aka The Public Speaker, shares how one entrepreneur used these skills to change his industry. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/29L7LWs

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 346 TPS Want to Add Humor to Your Speeches?
episodes.summary: Do you need to learn how to be more entertaining when you give presentations or speeches? Lisa B. Marshall, aka The Public Speaker, gives you the tools to be a more engaging speaker. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/29EpHmb

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 345 TPS How to Say You're Sorry with Apology Languages
episodes.summary: I terrible stay at hotel demonstrated to me that even people in finer establishments need lessons in how to apologize. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/28PX1ZG

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 344 TPS Why Leaders Ask and Don't Tell: An Interview with Edgar Schein
episodes.summary: Did you know that many major disasters could have been avoided had a junior person felt comfortable speaking up? Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/28Oozxj

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 343 TPS How Being Blunt Can Hurt Your Personal Life
episodes.summary: Blunt, undiplomatic communication can be a real problem. In fact, it can’t really be called communication because it actually closes the door to further discussion. Here, Lisa B. Marshall, aka The Public Speaker, gives some helpful advice for improvement in both business and personal communication. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/1PaXv5d

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 009 TPS Um, Like, How to Sound Ditzy?
episodes.summary: Learn to eliminate your distracting ums and ahs and other disfluencies.

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 342 TPS How to Acknowledge a Large Donation
episodes.summary: Thanking someone for a large donation should involve more than just a thank-you note. Lisa B. Marshall, aka The Public Speaker, gives tips on how to best acknowledge a large gift. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/1s3qMtC

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 341 TPS Want to Speak Up More at Meetings?
episodes.summary: Do you feel like you can speak in public everywhere except in front of your colleagues? This is not uncommon, but it is important to overcome, as it could hamper your career. Lisa B. Marshall, aka The Public Speaker, has some tips to help you be more confident at your next meeting. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/1XKXPPg

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 340 TPS How Rate of Speech Impacts Diplomacy
episodes.summary: How much does the pace of speech matter in diplomatic speaking? What about credibility or persuasiveness? It matters a lot. And Lisa B. Marshall, aka The Public Speaker, gives you the details on how to use it to your advantage and that of your audience. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/1WZszLC

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 339 TPS Find Your Storytelling Style to Engage Your Audience
episodes.summary: Storytelling is an important part of being human. Stories connect us to each other; they create a bond. We all love to hear stories, but can we tell them? Whether you’re a business professional giving a presentation, or a story-lover who wants to share stories with others, Lisa B. Marshall, aka The Public Speaker, will tell you how to deliver a great story to keep your listeners riveted. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/23hefhR

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 338 TPS The Secrets of Storytelling: An Interview with Author Carmine Gallo
episodes.summary: The ability to create and tell powerful stories is by far the most important skill of a leader because it can change minds, spark action, and stir passion.  Lisa B, Marshall interviews best selling author Carmine Gallo about his latest book: The Storyteller’s Secret: From TED Speakers to Business Legends, Why Some Ideas Catch On and Others Don’t. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/1SUcswt

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 337 TPS What the 'Serial' Podcast Can Teach Us About Storytelling
episodes.summary: Storytelling is an important part of being human. We all love to hear stories, but can we tell them? The better we tell stories, the better we will connect with people in both our personal and our professional lives. In this episode, Lisa B. Marshall, aka The Public Speaker, will tell you how to hook people into your stories. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/1QL1tRs

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 336 TPS Can You Save Your Job? What to Do If You're About to Be Fired
episodes.summary: In our current economy, job security can’t always be counted on. Sadly, many people find themselves in a position of being asked to resign, or just plain getting fired. Can you improve your job performance and save your job? Lisa B. Marshall, aka The Public Speaker, offers advice on how to handle the awkward meeting with the boss, to give you the best chance to save your job or ease the transition into a new one. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/1Q87OpN

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 288 TPS What Is Your DISC Style?
episodes.summary: Do you know what drives you? What holds you back?  What are your roadblocks to achieving the results and successes you desire in your career? To find out, take the free DISC communication style assessment right now! Read the transcript here: http://bit.ly/18OsfKA

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 335 TPS Are You Too Blunt?
episodes.summary: Have you ever been given feedback that you are too direct, brutally blunt, brusque or abrupt? Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/1SdeFQm

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 334 TPS Read, Write, and Practice to Strengthen Your Vocabulary
episodes.summary: Do you ever come across words you don’t understand? Or is English your second language and you want to build your vocabulary? Whether you’re a native speaker or a language learner, having a strong vocabulary is an important ingredient for success in business. But building that vocabulary requires strategy. Lisa B. Marshall, aka The Public Speaker, gives you a strategy that will reap great rewards. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/1WQo8Ru

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 333 TPS How to Fix Your Voice
episodes.summary: Whether you are podcaster, a speaker, an actor, or a business professional developing the quality of your voice will help to have more impact with a powerful delivery. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/1Rk2c2G

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 332 TPS Here's Why (and How) to Scrap Your Elevator Pitch
episodes.summary: Do you know the best way to deliver a professional introduction?  Have you ever been advised to create a memorized elevator pitch touting the features and benefits of your products and services? Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/1S36vwe

episodes.seriesTitle: The Public Speaker's Quick and Dirty Tips for Improving Your Communication Skills
episodes.title: 331 TPS The Essential Conversation Starters You Need Now
episodes.summary: Do you have trouble starting a conversation? Lisa B. Marshall, aka The Public Speaker, will help you develop this extremely important skill. Read the full transcript here: http://bit.ly/1TIvK94
